question.text: A solid cylinder of mass $2 \mathrm{~kg}$ and radius $50 \mathrm{~cm}$ rolls up an inclined plane of angle inclination $30^{\circ}$. The centre of mass of cylinder has speed of $4 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$. The distance travelled by the cylinder on the inclined surface will be : (Take $g=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2$ )

solution.text:
When a body rolls i.e. have rotational motion, the total kinetic energy of the system will be $$ \mathrm{KE}=\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{mv}^2\left(1+\frac{\mathrm{k}^2}{\mathrm{R}^2}\right) $$ where, $\mathrm{m}=$ mass of body, $\mathrm{v}=$ velocity and $\mathrm{k}=$ radius of gyration
Given, $\mathrm{m}=2 \mathrm{~kg}, \theta=30^{\circ}, \mathrm{v}=4 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}$ Let $h$ be the height of the inclined plane, then from law of conservation of energy, $$ \begin{aligned} \mathrm{KE} & =\mathrm{PE} \\ \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{mv}^2\left(1+\frac{\mathrm{k}^2}{\mathrm{R}^2}\right) & =\mathrm{mgh} \end{aligned} $$ Substituting the given values in the above equation, we get $$ \begin{aligned} & \frac{1}{2} \times 2 \times 16\left(1+\frac{1}{2}\right)=2 \times 10 \times \mathrm{h}\left[\because \text { For cylinder } \frac{\mathrm{k}^2}{\mathrm{R}^2}=\frac{1}{2}\right] \\ & \Rightarrow \quad 8 \times \frac{3}{2}=10 \mathrm{~h} \Rightarrow \mathrm{h}=1.2 \mathrm{~m} \end{aligned} $$ From the above diagram $$ \begin{gathered} \sin \theta=\frac{\mathrm{h}}{\mathrm{x}} \\ \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}=\frac{\mathrm{h}}{\sin \theta}=\frac{1.2}{\sin 30^{\circ}}=1.2 \times 2=2.4 \mathrm{~m}\left[\because \sin 30^{\circ}=\frac{1}{2}\right] \end{gathered} $$
